painPoints.title: Scaling Customer Success Across 50,000+ Customers
painPoints.description: Ramp has grown from startup to serving 50,000+ businesses. Managing activation, retention, and expansion at scale while maintaining personalized service for enterprise accounts is a significant operational challenge.

evidence.text: Scaled Customer Success owns the activation, growth, and retention of Ramp's self-service customers. They are placing a big bet on the belief that there is significant untapped potential in their self-service accounts.
As an early member of the team, you will have the opportunity to help build and refine Ramp's Customer Success organization

painPoints.opportunity: Account Health Dashboard can provide visibility into health signals across thousands of accounts, enabling proactive intervention

painPoints.title: Multi-Product Expansion Visibility
painPoints.description: Ramp has 6 distinct product lines (cards, expense management, bill pay, procurement, travel, treasury). Identifying which existing customers are candidates for additional products is critical for their land-and-expand model.

evidence.text: Ramp's 200%+ net dollar retention driven by combination of growth in underlying customer spend and launch of additional products
As a member of the Growth Account Management team, you will deliver value to customers and revenue by owning expansion and retention

painPoints.opportunity: Whitespace Visualizer can map which products each customer has adopted and surface expansion opportunities across the 6 product lines

painPoints.title: Enterprise Customer Complexity
painPoints.description: Ramp is moving upmarket aggressively - enterprise customers doubled YoY to 2,200+. These accounts have complex buying committees and require multi-threaded relationships.

evidence.text: Ramp generates $100K+ annual recurring revenue from 2,200+ enterprise accounts
As Ramp pushes further upmarket, customer acquisition costs and retention will likely come under more pressure

painPoints.opportunity: Stakeholder Map can help visualize relationships across enterprise buying committees and identify gaps in coverage

painPoints.title: Renewal Pipeline Management at Scale
painPoints.description: With 50,000+ customers on annual contracts, managing renewal pipeline and ensuring proactive outreach at the right time is operationally challenging.

evidence.text: Customer Success Managers each manage a book of ~50-70 customers in Ramp's SMB and Mid-Market portfolio
Annual contract model with high customer volume requires systematic renewal tracking

painPoints.opportunity: Renewal Tracker provides 90/60/30 day pipeline view to ensure no renewal falls through the cracks

painPoints.title: Competitive Pressure from Well-Funded Rivals
painPoints.description: Ramp competes against Brex, SAP Concur, Coupa, and others. Demonstrating differentiated value and ROI to customers is critical for retention.

evidence.text: The spend-management market has become crowded with well-capitalized peers like Brex and Airbase, as well as established enterprise players such as SAP Concur and Coupa

painPoints.opportunity: ROI Calculator helps demonstrate concrete value to customers during competitive situations and renewals

pocRecommendations.rationale: With 6 product lines and 200%+ NDR driven by expansion, visualizing cross-sell opportunities across 50,000+ accounts is high-value. Directly addresses their land-and-expand model.
Ramp's focus on 'activation and retention' with scaled CS motion makes health visibility critical. Job posts explicitly mention building CS org and activation strategy.
50,000+ customers on annual contracts means massive renewal volume. Simple to build and immediately valuable for pipeline management.
Enterprise customer doubling YoY creates need for relationship visibility across complex buying committees. Critical for upmarket push.
Competitive pressure from Brex, Concur makes value demonstration important. Ramp already emphasizes 'save time and money' - ROI tool reinforces this.
